data.title: Actors Born on October 31
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in film and TV for the 31st of October. Browse actors, actresses and directors that were born on October 31.
data.text:
Olof Thiel, Swedish film score composer, under the pseudonym of Jacques Armand, born in Stockholm, Sweden (d. 1978)

Ethel Waters, American actress (Beulah), singer (Stormy Weather), born in Chester, Pennsylvania (d. 1977)

Eduard Franz, American actor (Zorro), born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin (d. 1983)

Dale Evans, American actress and singer (Roy Rogers Show), born in Uvalde, Texas (d. 2001)

1912 Ollie Johnston, American animator and the last living member of Disney's Nine Old Men, born in Palo Alto, California (d. 2008)

Anatoli Papanov, Russian actor (Cold Summer of 1953) named as a People's Artist of the USSR (1973), born in Vyazma, Russia (d. 1987)

1922 Barbara Bel Geddes, American actress (Vertigo, Dallas, Caught), born in New York City (d. 2005)

Norodom Sihanouk

King of Cambodia (1941-55 and 1993-2004), Chief of State (1960-70), independence campaigner and film producer, born in Phnom Penh, Cambodia

1922 Talfryn Thomas, Welsh character actor (Dad's Army -"Cheeseman"; Dr. Who), born in Swansea, Wales (d. 1982)

Lee Grant [Lyova Haskell Rosenthal], American actress (Shampoo, Mulholland Drive), born in New York City

Shirley Dinsdale, American ventriloquist (Judy Splinters), radio and television personality, born in San Francisco, California (d. 1999)

Andrew Sarris, American movie critic (Village Voice), born in Brooklyn, New York (d. 2012)

Bud Spencer, Italian actor (Aladdin, Extralarge, Go For It), born in Borgo Santa Lucia, Naples, Italy (d. 2016)

Dan Rather

American news anchor (CBS Evening News, 60 Minutes), born in Wharton, Texas

Norman Beaton, Guyanese actor (Eureka, Black Joy, Mighty Quinn), born in Georgetown, British Guiana (d. 1994)

Michael Landon

American actor (Bonanza - "Little Joe"; Little House on the Prairie - "Charles"; Highway to Heaven - "Jonathan"), born in Forest Hills, New York

Ron Rifkin [Saul Rifkin], American actor (Alias - "Arvin Sloane"; Brothers & Sisters; L.A. Confidential), born in New York City

1939 Tom O'Connor, British comedian and TV game show host, born in Bootle, Lancashire, England (d. 2021)

David Ogden Stiers, American stage and screen actor (M*A*S*H, 1977-83 - "Maj. Charles Emerson Winchester III"; Lilo & Stitch), born in Peoria, Illinois (d. 2018)

Brian Piccolo, American NFL football running back, 1965-69 (Chicago Bears), and subject of the 1971 TV movie "Brian's Song", born in Pittsfield, Massachusetts (d. 1970)

Sally Kirkland, American actress (Anna, Sting, Pvt Benjamin, Big Bad Mama), born in New York City

Brian Doyle-Murray, American comedian and actor (Groundhog Day), born in Chicago, Illinois

Norman Lovett, English stand-up comedian and actor (Red Dwarf), born in Windsor, Berkshire, England

1946 Stephen Rea, Irish film and stage actor (Crying Game, Michael Collins), born in Belfast, Northern Ireland

Deidre Hall, American actress (Days of our Lives, Our House), born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin

1947 Jennifer Hosten, Grenadian radio host and beauty queen (1st black Miss World 1970), born in St George's, Grenada

Jane Pauley, American newscaster (Today, NBC Weekend), born in Indianapolis, Indiana

John Candy

Canadian actor and comedian (SCTV, Uncle Buck), born in Newmarket, Ontario

Michael J. Anderson, American actor (The Man from Another Place), born in Denver, Coloroda

Ken Wahl [Anthony Calzaretta], American actor (Wiseguy, The Gladiator, The Wanderers), born in Chicago, Illinois

Brian Stokes Mitchell, American Broadway singer and actor, born in Seattle, Washington

Arnaud Desplechin, French film director and screenwriter, born in Roubaix, France

Peter Jackson

New Zealand film director (Lord of the Rings - Academy Award, Best Director, 2003), born in Wellington, New Zealand

Dermot Mulroney, American actor (Samantha, Sunset, Long Gone), born in Alexandria, Virginia

1963 Rob Schneider, American actor (Saturday Night Live, Jamie Coleman-Men Behaving Badly), born in San Francisco, California

Amanda Sandrelli, Italian actress (The Key), born in Lausanne, Switzerland

1964 Sanjeev Bhaskar, British actor, comedian (Goodness Gracious Me; The Kumars at No. 42), and chancellor (University of Sussex, 2009-present), born in Ealing, England

1964 The Boogeyman [Marty Wright], American professional wrestler, born in Phoenix, Arizona

Rob Rackstraw, British voice actor, born in Sunderland, England

Jon Wurster, American session and touring drummer (Superchunk; The Mountain Goats; Bob Mould), and comedy writer, born in Sellersville, Pennsylvania

1966 Koji Kanemoto, Japanese wrestler (NJPW/AAA/UWA, Tiger Mask, King Lee), born in Kobe, Hy≈çgo Prefecture, Japan

1966 Mike O'Malley, American actor (The Mike O'Malley Show), born in Boston, Massachusetts

Vanilla Ice

American rapper (Ice Ice Baby) and actor (Cool as Ice), born in Miami, Florida

Antonio Davis, American basketball forward (NBA All-Star 2001; Indiana Pacers), executive (President NBA Players Association 2005-06) and broadcaster (ESPN, SiriusXM), born in Oakland, California

Craig Kelly, English actor (Queer as Folk, Coronation Street), born in Lytham St Annes, England

1970 Nicky Wu, Taiwanese singer, actor and martial arts expert (Xiao Hu Dui/Little Tiger Team), born in Taipei, Taiwan

Matt Dawson, English rugby union halfback (77 caps England, 7 British & Irish Lions; Northampton, London Wasps) and broadcaster (A Question of Sport, BBC), born in Birkenhead, England

Piper Perabo, American actress (Covert Affairs), born in Dallas, Texas

Zachary Knighton, American actor (Happy Endings), born in Alexandria, Virginia

Saaphyri Windsor, American reality TV personality, born in Los Angeles, California

Eddie Kaye Thomas, American actor (American Pie, American Wedding), born in New York City

1980 Samaire Armstrong, American actress (It's A Boy Girl Thing), born in Tokyo, Japan

Justin Chatwin, Canadian actor (War of the Worlds), born in Nanaimo, Canada

Katy French, Irish Supermodel and Socialite, born in Basel, Switzerland (d. 2007)

Christie Hayes, Australian actress (Home and Away), born in North Nowra, New South Wales, Australia

Lil JJ [James Charles Lewis], American actor (Just Jordan) and singer ("Party Boi"), born in Little Rock, Arkansas

Jordan-Claire Green, American actress (School of Rock), born in Terceira Island, Portugal

Letitia Wright, English actress (Black Panther), born in Georgetown, Guyana

Spencer Achtymichuk, Canadian actor (The Final Cut)

Willow Smith

American actress, singer ("Whip My Hair") and dancer, born in Los Angeles, California
